name: SimplePlanes
description: Build airplanes by snapping parts together, designing wing sections, and attaching engines. At any time, you can strap yourself into the cockpit and see how it flies with realistic physics. If you're not in the mood for building, over 100,000 airplanes are available to download for free.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7 SP1 Processor: Core 2 Duo Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: SM3 512MB VRAM Storage: 750 MB available space
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 7 or newer Processor: Core i5 Memory: 4 GB RAM Graphics: SM4 1GB VRAM Storage: 1 GB available space

reviews.review_text: Give us the ♥♥♥♥ing Multiplayer!!! :DDD .....Pretty please. :)
If it looks stupid but it flies, it ain't stupid  10/10 would crash again
This game was worth every minute I played till now. Concept 9/10. Physics 8/10. Graphics 8/10 (even runs on quite slow computers). I give this game a solid 5/7.

This game is awesome. I loved the android version but this one takes the cake. This game has no limitations. Ive built tanks, boats, helicopters and all kinds of crazy ♥♥♥♥ in this game. Its like a mini version of ksp but dedicated to planes and not rockets.
Brilliant Game!

This game is so fun, I play it everyday after school. I paid the 13 bucks for the game, and it was totally worth it. I can build everything from Props to Jets and have fun doing it. Even my dad plays it sometimes!

One of my favorite games for simple reasons.  1: The developers actually care about what the community thinks. 2: Modding.. It is actually really simple to modify the game if you know how. Its also really easy to learn how. 3: Simple Interface.. Like I said... Simple. 4: A nice beginners tutorial. This game is so simple you really dont need it but I would advise checking it out. 5: Simple, Beautiful graphics for those low end computers. 6: The community itself, Tons of planes are released each day and every keeps making better and better planes. 7: Everything.. Just everything is awesome. It is definitely a game to love if you like exploding things and building things. -Ctracerx2 of the SP community! I am proud to be a part of it!

A game where you can make a plane out of everything you want, like a shoe or ... a bottle or something like that. and when the plane doest fly the crashes are fun. also the comunity output is huge so there are many great planes out there. For the price its realy great!  9/11 would crash bottle-shoe-plane again

When is multiplayer coming? D: On a more serious note, this is a brilliant game to test your creativity to the test in creating all kinds of aircraft, or cars, and I really recommend this game. My name is PixArt by the way

I saw this game on sale, never heard of it before. I saw it for a second and was immediately interested, though hesitant. I didn't really want to waste my money, so I looked up a video. Thought it looked cool and took a risk with this game. It payed off. MASSIVELY. I've owned the game for 2 or 3 days and have already played for 20 hours. Addicting as hell. Buy this game. if you want to break up with your girlfriend by ignoring her for months.
Great Game. Stop reading the reviews and buy it! and if your the 1% that dont like it get a refund

I feel that El Kemosabe's review does a spot-on job of describing my feelings for the game, so I'll just say that if his review leaves you on the fence about whether to buy the game(even when discounted), if nothing else, purchase this if you want a game you can really mod the ♥♥♥♥ out of. SP's mod support is exemplary, and as one of the few big modders in the community, I'd love to have more people joining the modding force. Hellfire and I can't make everything!  Experience: been with the game since the first alpha was announced about a year and a half ago, one of the few big modders for the game(done two terrain mods, and am working on the SImpleWarships mod and the SimplePlanes Multiplayer mod in partnership with fellow reddit community member HellFireKoder).
You will be a Designer, Engineer, Pilot, Driver...

I love airplanes and recently studied airplane design. Sure it's not hyper-realistic, but gave me something to do while dodging my family during the holidays.   Fun to build, fun to fly, good flight physics. Area is a little small, but well designed.  9.5/10
Although it isn't the most realistic flight simulator, it's fun to build your own airplanes, no matter how outragous. It's altogether a good game to buy on sale.

This is the best flight simulator ever created in my opinion! but that alone isn't very helpfull. The game has a variety of good features that the trailer does not showcase, like the amazing run speed, the destructible bridges and the fact that you can go underwater! (well you can see the plane when it crashes into the sea while its underwater)  Over all it is an amazing game and you should pick it up right away!

I highly recommend this game to the creative minds of the Steam Community.  It's a fun game with a simple texture design (This means that even my old Windows laptop can run the game with over 40 FPS). The controls can be a bit hard when you start, but you can always insert a controller (Not a PS, or Xbox controller) to make the planes easier to fly, and the game responds very well to the controller.  Again, I highly recommend this game to the Creative Minds of the Steam Community, so if you feel creative and need to relax? Then this is the perfect game for you!

Also: KEEP CHECKING THE COM AND COL. Many aeroplanes have met their............ premature demise at the hands of a CoL exactley on the CoM.

A Spot on build and play game that brings a good feel in your inner self as you play. This game allows you to build so much, with so many options. You can either make a 'Simple plane' Or you can make a highly detailed airplane such as a Fw-190, a P-51, A B-17, whatever your fancy. This game is definitely worth 12.99 at this point, The only thing i have to gripe about, even though i don't usually care, because to me, gameplay and experiance is better, however the graphics in this game look like they would be perfect for the Playstation 2 era games. I mean, I know this game is supposed to be 'Simple' but the graphics, Like i said, i don't think graphics are the most important, but i definitely don't think they should be the least. Now that i think about it, another thing i gripe about, and this is the 2nd most important thing a game needs in my opinion, Is sound. Sound is a very important factor on immersion, i feel like sound is more important than graphics. The thing that kinda annoys me in this game, is the fact that the Radial engine in this game sounds like a Merlin V-12 I wish we could add custom engine sounds, or atleast get to modify all that jazz without having to go to unity maker and make a new part.  Also... Things in this game explode way too easily, not in crashing, but the weapons... It's kinda boring if one round hits the plane and a nuclear bomb goes off. If i have something like a B-17 just explode after a single hit every time, it gets boring, it's not fun seeing a nuclear explosion everytime a plane gets struck once by a small projectile... Unless it's an actual atomic bomb.
a game that I have spent many hours
90% of my time playing this game is spent crashing my planes in the stupid ways... 10/10

You start off making potaoes with wings, and then you go on to make slightly bigger potatoes with wings. You go to the workshop to find perfect replicas of historical warplanes and functioning space ships. You attempt to make them and fail, causing you to get bored and quit. To be able to build anyhting worthwhile you need to have a tremendous amount of patience. It is fun to fool around with and build rocket-powered oddities, but do not expect to build anything realistic without looking at a guide, as I still cannot build anything interesting after 73 hours.

This game closely resembles Kerbal Space Program. The game employs same attachment node system and simplified aerodynamics, that, exactly I as KSP player is used to, along parts and tools I have seen as mods such as BDArmory, KAX or KerbPaint. Except some mission features and game's focus on atmospheric flight rather than spaceflight, I don't see a fundamental selling point out of this game or a difference between this and KSP. So I don't recomment buying this game.

I bought this game expecting an easy and intuitive building system to create various different aircraft, and able to build anything of any size. And while the blocks that you have to build with are just basic shapes... It's just that... Basic. Which honestly, can be a detriment to the game, rather than improving. I found building larger aircraft tedious and near impossible, while with smaller designs, you are actually rather limited with what you can do, mainly stuck with doing light, single-engined fighters for the most part.  All in all, I didn't find this game enjoyable at all, and I will probably be uninstalling it very shortly.

I love this game, its like KSP with better physics the only real issues i have with this game are the pain of designing certain aircraft for example i made a Ryan fireball and the rear jet engine didnt run due to the (as far as i can tell) air intake not getting air despite it being placed in a perfect location the game would be a lot better with a more smoothed out way of building without having to mod parts to get certain sizes another thing this game sorely needs is a workshop currently you have to go to the main site to download planes (which in all fairness isnt that hard to do) but some way of getting creations noticed easier would be awsome. overall i would give this game 7/10 purely because its build system needs some work.

This game is a blast to play! Pros:  +THE CHALLENGES! These are awesome! It makes the game like pilotwings, only you build the airplane too. +Lots of ways to use the parts.  +Freedom to build stuff that won't ever work. I love that the game lets you fail. +Easy to use building system, took me very little time to get the basics. +Physics realistic enough to be believable, but not so realistic that it isn't fun. +Runs very smoothly +Tons of downloadable Planes Cons:  -Not enough challenges. As I said, I think this IS the game. It needs more challenges.  Overall, I am enjoying my experience with this game. If you like Besiege, Terratech, Space Engineers or other building/engineering games, you will most likely enjoy this game as well.

Also you can dogfight against a computer opponent   9/10 just because there is no multiplayer

I may have bought this game for a different reason to most other users. You see, I was planning a vacation course for some of my elementary students based on aviation and flight and had two weeks of activities all laid out. Still, I was looking for a nice way to polish off the course and this came my way.   I know they are into video games and the 'Minecraft' way of doing things, so on the penultimate day I got them to design their own planes, which I brought home, built through thsi game and then recorded the test flights and design modifications to play back the following day.  Needless to say, it was a hit (especially when the planes went wrong), so for my review, let's catalogue my journey to classroom success.  Game purchased and downloaded and this was followed by the basic tutorials. Yep, straightforward enough, let's go.  Ambitious start; let's build a twin-engine plane ina fighter configuration. Test fly it... Nope, that didn't work. Make a few tweaks and discover another way of creating a fireball. Forget that! Bin the design and start again.  I decide to base the next design on real-world plane and go for a SAAB Viggen lookalike. Visually it all makes sense. i feel I know enough to judge that, in principle, it should fly. Wow!  More explosions.  Decide to go back to the drawing board, but before I do i download a couple of pre-designed planes. Yep, they work, so I start thinking about where I'm going wrong and slowly, slowly, better working aircraft begin to emerge from my internal design house.  13 Aircraft in, plus 4 variants, I was ready for the kids designs.  All in all, the game has a solid learning curve and presents some nice challenges. The construction screen sometimes moves pieces in weird ways, but practice and patience gets you past this easily enough. Exploring the options and displays helps you figure out what works and what doesn't and (if you're of a problem-solving mentality), will have you sitting there pondering just how to get that centre of balance just right.  It isn;t the most visually appealing sim, I'm not convinced that the physics are always spot on and the game has no real objective beyond that 'Yes, I did it!' moment, but frankly, that has been enough for me. It is surprisingly good fun and even though the course has passed, I'm back on the game trying to refine and improve upon myown designs (and will perhaps see if I can improve a little on some of my students' designs before next semester).  As a fun way of experimenting with your understanding of planes, it is great and I highly recommend it.

SimplePlanes... It is an addictive simulator game in which you (probably) build and (probably) fly (probably) airplanes... Just imagine: You try to build your very first airplane, then test it and... You experiment to modify the airplanes you find.. Then you upload your first (thing) to community! Returning to the editor, you finally build your airplane. I originally bought SimplePlanes as a fun little mobile game about 1, 1/2 years ago. Little did I realize how enjoyable the game actually was. At the time, the game had few features, but was fun nonetheless. After the death of my Ipad (the device it ran on) I switched to android and lost the game. So when I found it for online, I was more than happy to spend a few dollars. And now its on Steam, and has many more features than before.   So why do I recomend the game?  Pros-  *Easy to run (will virtually run on anything). *Extensive library of player made planes to choose from. *Cross platform capability (planes on Ios will work on PC or Android). *Simple to use, but fully capable of creating good looking planes. *Excelent playerbase. *Plane physics. ie: wings tearing off, falls apart on crash. *Simple and fun.  Cons-  *Graphics are minimal (definitely not a bad thing, I personally love it). *No workshop (but is extremely easy to download planes). *No multiplayer (not that I'm complaining).  Overall a good game, simple and fun.
its fun a creative but... can tou make an fuselage adapter pls...

It's a barebones mobile app for PC... on screen joysticks are displaying and joystick controls aren't quite fine tuned. Not set to work with some joystick throttles yet. Aside from that, it's still fun to play. Maybe I should have purchased for iOS instead.
cool

not sure what to say about this game.  i only have 7 hours into it, so i'm no expert yet.  i'm a flight simulator guy, so i figured it was going to seem lacking in the physics department for my taste, and i was right.  because the physics are kinda 'meh', tweaking a design once you have it flying doesn't seem to reward you much.  it's tricky for the developer i'm sure, as you probably can't make a game like this, and also expect to compete on a physics level with something like x-plane.  but i think the developer should try to do more, to make refining designs feel worthwhile.  little stuff like simulation of stall, so you can create designs that demonstrate the effects you see in the real world like the difference between a design that 'mushes' in a stall vs. 'breaks' in a stall.  physics for landing like effects for flare, and some ground stuff demonstrating low wing/high wing design differences.  pitch and power physics are weak, and there is no mechanism for tweaking static trim, or adding mechanical trim.  all physics fidelity complaintsin a game that i can understand might not be trying that hard for flight physics.  so, the other problem i see, if flight physics isn't going to be a driving effort, is to make the game more fun.  i think the funnest thing the game could do next to leverage what is currently there is ...  implement MULTIPLAYER.  the game does have the features to build or download all kinds of fun and goofy flying toys ... AND ... it has all the cool weaponry stuff.  put that stuff to good use with a great multiplayer engine, WITH A LOBBY FEATURE, SERVER BROWSER, and a backend you can download and run on a Linux machine as a DEDICATED SERVER.  with multiplayer, i would add obviously PvP ... but i would ALSO ADD PvE.  and, i would add more parts in the builder UI to be able to build land fixtures so that you could add those fixtures in the game to decorate and blow up.  i would think it could be really fun to take a 'heavy bomber' and have competitions to see who could do the most damage to a small town in the game !  stuff like that, along with the obvious stuff like dogfighting etc.  that sounds fun, and i don't need alot of fiddly physics stuff for that !  as it stands now, for me, i'm not unhappy i bought it and funded an indie developer, but my advice, and wish for the developer is to do 1 of the 2 things i've mentioned to make the game better at something, rather than mediocre at a couple of things, or ... best case, do it all !  keep working on it !
FINALLY i got it on pc for such a cheap price VERY VERY GOOD TOTS RECOMMEND IT ALSO i make planes for simple planes check my planes out if u can spare sometime my gamer name is Theflyingauzzie

this game is great. the editor is not the best but it is very usable and lets you design a lot of different contraptions that will actually fly. the landscape is fun to fly through, even without anything to shoot at or chase after.  the dogfights could use some work,  a lot of them end in a 'who hits first' way and the planes just explode/fall apart upon death. once you are onto an AI enemy it does not feel like it is attacking you but just trying to get away.  if you like to build and fly, you will not regret buying this game. the developer is active and helpful on the discussion boards.  8/10 , they should all be like this.

fun to play, difficult to master every little bit to the game, keep supporting it, that way they can add more parts and maybe make parts look more streamlined, it has much potential and it is basically in a stage it just needs the obvious improvements to be better so all the more reason to give it a try at the least!

Basic knowledge of airplane physics is recommended but not required to enjoy the game. Physics seem to be accurate enough, although occlusion is not taken into account as of the time of this review (early access). Therefore, wings and engines placed inside the plane still provide lift and thrust.

SimplePlanes is misnamed. As simple as it is to build planes, the entire ecosphere that's been created here is not simple. There are tons of different ways to play and enjoy this. For ¬$10 this simulator offers a fun entry into aeronautical engineering.  It's enjoyable to mess around with some absurd designs to see what definately won't work.  It does have it's limitations however: for example how it calculates lift, drag and other fluid properties is not clear ( eg. propwash, stall speed ) There are design limitaions as well: cannot alter wing camber, angle of attack ect.  Having said that, for $10 it is definately worth a try

First play (I don't remember the date): I've lost my self not knowing what to do (Yes there's a tutorial, but I ain't got time for that or I'm too lazy to take it). I tried to crate something that could fly, built something that looked kinda decent, starting the engines make the plane to a total 180 without launching to fly.  Up-date (I don't remember the date): Practiced my plane building, at least now I can make something that can fly. After some more time, I learned to asign number activation commands. After even more time, 'I know I am not the best plane builder, but I can make some war machines'. ---------------------------------------------------------- First veredict (I don't remember tha date): The game seems fun.  Up-date (I don't remember the date): The game is totally fun once you learn how to make plains, to take the tutorial is a must if you don't want to spend much time trying to figure it out for yourself. There's a few glitches here and there, like sometimes the turvines of my plane wouldn't activate in combat mode or free flying (I know those are not the name of the gamplay modes).  Final Veredict It is really a good game despite the glitches it has. It can provide quite a good time of fun.

This is a wonderful game! It has a few issues, but they are minor nitpicks at best. This game is just like somebody took away the space part of Kerbal Space Program, but left the humor and plane physics. The simple graphics allow this to run on almost any machine, and the planes are realisticaly simulated. Some nitpicks I have are the plane controls being unresponsive at times, and when parts in the creator stick together, though that can be fixed with a cockpit. I would recommend this game to anyone who has a few hours to kill.

I love making planes from scratch. Sure it's more rudimentary than KSP, but it also has features that KSP doesn't have. Like customizable part shaps. And you can make a boat. and it has weapons! The only thing that grinds my gears is the handling of land vehicles which suck bad.

I came across this game on YouTube. It reminded me of Kerbal Space Program, but without the space. It also seemed to run better on low-end PCs. One day I felt like building a plane so I got the game.  ...Its harder than you might first expect. I mean, we've all seen what airliners look like, right? Just put some wings on, strap on some engines and off you go! ...except you then do lots of flips and then crash into the ground.  This is a game that isn't for everyone- some may just play it once and never again. Others might play it loads. I'm somehwere inbetween: I only tend to play if I have some ideas about what to build. Its like a concept testing ground. I like to see what sort of unusual designs will fly.  If you want to build stuff in 3D and see if it flies, this game is probably for you. If not but you're still considering it, its probably worth watching some YouTube gameplay first to see. PhlyDaily and JackSepticeye have done gameplay videos on it, to name a few.  P.S. it really does run well on lower-end machines. I get good FPS (cannot notice any FPS slowdown) and I use a nVidia GeForce 210. Kerbal Space Program is essentially unplayable for me in comparison (15 FPS at good times).

I absolutely love this game. I have spent endless hours on it and have learned a little bit about flight dynamics as well. I have enjoyed completing the races and design challenges. I would love to see updates in the future with more advanced airfoil physics, more advanced aerodynamic analysis tools, and lots more design challenges. Thanks for developing a great game!

Simple Planes keep things simple, but with a twist. Your imagination must do the rest. I like the game overall. It's going to expand your imagination, engineering skills which might prove usefull later on in life like any other skill! I don't mind the simple graphics at all. I was not aware it was acually designed for Smart Phones, it looked like PC quality. I'm not an engineer but I sure feel like one right now :) I think the Laws of Physics still apply because if your plane dose not fly well, it means you made an error and its great to get that visual feedback with humor. I wish the man's voice from the intro videos would be implemented on the other hand.

I really like this game and I'll tell you why.  When I started I decided to skip the tutorial because tutorials are for losers. That was a mistake I would not suggest trying to learn this game on your own, as the mechanics are quite complex. Even now I struggle to make anything that can get off the ground.   Once I made a plane that could fly SimplePlanes got 1000% better. It Can be incredibly relaxing to just drift allong and listen to the music(which is great by the way) or you can enter a dogfight and destroy enemy ships. Also there is so much to explore and do it takes a while for the overworld to get boring. There is also really great workshop content if you are starting to get bored like a space map, planes capable of reaching 10,000 mph, or massive war blimps.   There are a couple of things that I think should and probably will be added. First, I know everyone is ranting about multiplayer and I agree it would be awesome to fight other people to the death,race your epic ship against theirs, or simply play around. Also I would enjoy more maps such as a dessert or city. Some new parts such as heli blades or cannons.   But in summary I think this game is worth the money and the effort to learn how to build a simpleplane.

This game is fantastic and the possibilities are nearly endless. Once you get a hang of all the techniques in building your craft, you can make realistic replicas of existing planes, or exactly the opposite. Definitely worth the price.
A fun game - if you like flying simulations.

As someone who has had this since the closed alpha test, (I have upwards of 20 hours game time I reckon) I will say this:  Pros: + Sandbox mode + Missions to give you things to do + Weapons  + Lots of content made by others so you don't have to (If you're lazy like me)  Cons: - Everyone elses planes will be better than yours - No multiplayer (yet) - Can get very repetative - In my opinion, it costs too much for what it is - Ai in dogfight mode will crash enemy plane into the ground 9/10 times  All in all, it's a good game, can get repetative quickly but is fun while it lasts, I would wait and get it on at least a 40% sale, and overall, I'd give it 7/10
this game is bob the builder type of game if u like it   {;

A quick review of this game: The title shows exactly what it is. It is a simple game about planes. Build your own, download others, or even download boats and cars! 8/10.   A longer review of this game: This is a great game for those who want to make their own planes or only know the basic functions of planes. FSX is all about advanced aspects of flying, such as n1, n2, how to start the engine, checklists, atc, etc. Many people just want to fly a plane. Thats were this game kicks in. WIth its fair share of mods, and many other ways to create and download your own custom planes, (and worlds) This is a great game for those who want to fly planes(including military planes with bombs, missles, and guns which actually work!) without prior knowledge, or simply do not want the hassle, download this game. It's a great flying game(I wouldn't necessarily consider this game as a simulator) Final Verdict:  8/10.  PS, plane building is a skill which takes time to learn and master in this game. However, it is still easy. Unless you go complex:)

Firstly, I love this game because you can drive all over Europe. You have to manage your money, and make sure that, when you get out a loan from the bank, you have enough money to pay it back, or are at least making enough daily profit to pay it back.  You also manage a business. You can hire drivers to work for you, and they will complete jobs for you, but you have to pay them a wage, plus some for every journey they complete. You level up they skills, that make them be better at certian things, like you can make them earn more money for going over a set distance, or you can make them carry high value or fragile cargo. They can also carry ADR materials, so things that could be dangourous. But you get paid more for that.  You can always do 'Quick Jobs', and these are when the employer provides the truck, and you just go where they tell you. This is fun, but it starts to get boring, only doing short deliverys, so you can buy a truck, so that you can go further distances, and get more money.  To conclude, I feel that anybody who likes games like Farm Simulator, or any simulator game should give this game a try, because it is a great way to unwind after a long day, and I have found it to be so much fun and very calming. Some people say that this is a boring game, I happen to disagree.
